remarks: Two ways to express single-valuedness of a class expression ` C ( y ) ` .  (Contributed by NM, 16-Dec-2012.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 18-Nov-2016.)
statement:
reusv1 $p |- ( E. y e. B ph -> ( E! x e. A A. y e. B ( ph -> x = C ) <-> E. x e. A A. y e. B ( ph -> x = C ) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d C x $.
$d ph x $.
$d x y $.
